March 1, 1961
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
School of Journalism and Communications
University of Illinois
Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
I would very much like to have you at our meeting
March 15th in Milwaukee. We are going to take up
some rather important matters, and I very much need
the benefit of your wide experience with NAEB. I
appreciate the difficulties of freeing yourself front¬
ing teaching obligations, but if there is any way
of doing so, I hope it can be managed. Your expenses
will be paid by NAEB.
We would also very much like to have you at the
banquet Tuesday night honoring the officers of the
Fund for Adult Education, who did so much for NAEB
and the cause of educational broadcasting in general.
Frankly, Harry, I would feel much more confident
about the board setting a wise course with refer¬
ence to a couple of important policy matters if I
knew that you would be participating in the delib¬
erations .
Cordially yours.
William G. Harley
